group_descriptions: Linear Subsidence: Plots in Row 1 and most of Row 2 show a constant, straight-line downward trend where the end slope remains steep (e.g., < -0.9).
Flattening/Arresting Subsidence: Plots in Row 3, Row 4, and [2,3] show a 'hockey stick' curve, starting with a drop but flattening out to a horizontal trend (end slope > -0.3).
gemini_response.observation: There is a clear structural difference based on the temporal evolution. About half the cluster follows a straight line (constant velocity), while the other half (generally those with lower average slope numbers) follows a decay curve where the deformation arrests/stops in the latter half of the time series.
